intro: Sarcocephalus nervosus, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, star-shaped berries that are rich in vitamin C. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its medicinal properties, it is also used in traditional African medicine.
